p: The second bioclimatic domain of the argan biosphere corresponds to the mountains in the western part of High Atlas and northern slopes of the western Anti-Atlas, which are exposed to Atlantic influences and affected by the North Atlantic Oscillation (Delannoy 1988). The climatic characteristics, for lack of an appropriate climatic network, are still difficult to specify. However, the high altitudes receive relatively high amount of precipitation, estimated at 500 to 600 mm, and high cloudiness linked to the North Atlantic Oscillation. This domain corresponds, globally, to the Thermo-Mediterranean belt and locally to the Meso-Mediterranean.
